newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch brewer Grolsch profits up.
newsitem.headline: Dutch brewer Grolsch profits up.

text.p: Dutch brewer Grolsch NV posted an 11 percent rise in half-year profits Wednesday and said it expects profits for the full year to be higher than in 1995.
It said it earned 21.0 million guilders ($12.61 million) in the first six months, vs a 18.9 million guilders ($11.34 million).

Revenues increased to 319.9 million guilders ($192 million) from a previous 260.1 million guilders ($156 million), with operating profits up to 35.5 million guilders ($21.3 million) from 29.5 million ($17.7 million).
The profit figure was in line with analysts' forecasts.
"On balance we expect another profit rise for the full year in line with our earlier forecasts," the brewer said.
Grolsch said in March it expected a further profit rise in 1996. Its net profits in 1995 rose 12 percent to 58.8 million guilders ($35.29 million).
